meanings.definition: The quality or state of being oncogenic.
meanings.sent1: The oncogenicities of certain chemicals can lead to the development of cancer.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are studying the oncogenicities of different substances to understand their impact on health.
meanings.sent3: The oncogenicities of these mutated cells are like tiny troublemakers causing chaos in the body.
meanings.sent4: Her reckless behavior had the oncogenicities of a ticking time bomb, waiting to explode.
meanings.sent5: The oncogenicities of UV radiation were compared to a silent assassin, slowly damaging cells over time.

meanings.sent1: Exposure to asbestos increases the oncogenicities of developing mesothelioma.
meanings.sent2: Doctors assess the oncogenicities of different tumors to determine the best treatment plan.
meanings.sent3: The oncogenicities of eating too much sugar could be described as a sweet but dangerous temptation.
meanings.sent4: The oncogenicities of secondhand smoke linger in the air, posing a risk to everyone nearby.
meanings.sent5: The oncogenicities of a sedentary lifestyle were likened to planting seeds of cancer in the body.
